meanings.sent1: The judge is annulling the contract.
meanings.sent3: By annulling the ticket, he avoided the long queue.
meanings.sent4: The storm annulled all hopes of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: Annulling the decision made everything clear.

meanings.sent1: They are annulling the flight booking.
meanings.sent2: He had to annul his plans due to unexpected guests.
meanings.sent3: Annulling the appointment left her with free time.
meanings.sent4: The rain annulled the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: She annulled the subscription to save money.

meanings.sent1: The government is annulling the law.
meanings.sent2: He decided to annul his decision and start over.
meanings.sent4: The magician annulled the spell with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent5: Annulling the license led to consequences.

meanings.sent1: The new evidence annulled the previous ruling.
meanings.sent2: She tried to annul the effects of her mistake.
meanings.sent3: Annulling the effect of the potion was a relief.
meanings.sent4: His apology annulled the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: Annulling the contract nullified any obligations.
